intro: Crossopetalum caymanense, commonly known as the Cayman Islands mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Cayman Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red flowers that bloom during the wet season. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in coastal and sandy soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for pollinators.
